TEXT: A nurse is caring for a patient diagnosed with community-acquired pneumonia. Which nursing interventions are appropriate for this patient? Select all that apply.
ANSWER_2: Maintain head of bed elevation at 30-45 degrees
ANSWER_3: Administer antibiotics as prescribed on time
ANSWER_4: Restrict fluid intake to prevent pulmonary edema
ANSWER_5: Place the patient in a supine position for lung expansion

TEXT: A nurse is implementing care for a patient with an indwelling urinary catheter. Which of the following interventions should be included in the care plan? Select all that apply.
ANSWER_1: Assess for urinary retention using a bladder scanner
ANSWER_2: Ensure the catheter is secured to prevent traction
ANSWER_3: Maintain the drainage bag below the level of the bladder
ANSWER_4: Cleanse the perineal area with antiseptic solution every 8 hours
ANSWER_5: Routinely irrigate the catheter every shift to maintain patency

TEXT: The image shows a patient with deep vein thrombosis (DVT) of the left leg. Which nursing interventions are appropriate for this patient? Select all that apply.
ANSWER_1: Elevate the limb above the level of the heart
ANSWER_2: Apply warm compresses to the affected area,Assess distal pulses, sensation, and capillary refill
ALT_TEXT: Image of left leg showing redness, swelling, and edema characteristic of deep vein thrombosis (DVT)
